conclusion: Analyze forces on bodies A, B, and C for equilibrium conditions.
Body C is influenced by gravity and normal forces from A and B.
Gravitational force on C is mg, acting vertically downward.
Normal forces N_A and N_B are directed along the radii of hemispheres.
Vertical components of normal forces balance weight of C: N_A sin θ + N_B sin θ = mg.
Horizontal components of normal forces balance each other: N_A cos θ = N_B cos θ.
Normal forces N_A and N_B are equal: N_A = N_B = N.
2N sin θ = mg and N cos θ = N cos θ.
Body A experiences weight, normal force from C, normal force from ground, and frictional force from ground.
Weight of A is mg, acting vertically downward.
Normal force from C is N, acting at angle θ.
Normal force from ground F acts vertically upward.
Frictional force from ground f acts horizontally.
Vertical forces equilibrium: F = mg + N cos θ.
Horizontal forces equilibrium: f = N sin θ.
Maximum static friction force f_max is given by f_max = μF.
For static equilibrium: f ≤ f_max.
Substitute coefficient of friction: f = N sin θ ≤ μF = μ(mg + N cos θ).
Solve for F and f using equilibrium condition.
Substitute given μ = √3/6: N sin θ = √3/6 (mg + N cos θ).
Assume θ such that sin θ = √3/2 and cos θ = 1/2.
Simplify: N √3/2 = √3/6 (mg + N 1/2).
Simplify further: 3N = mg + N/2.
Solve: 6N = 2mg + N.
